data.title: Why is the Gilan province of Iran sometimes written Guilan?
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 3): Because of English orthographical rules that dictate phonetical rules, the possibility of it accidently being pronounced as Jilan /dʒiːlɒːn/ instead of Gilan /giːlɒːn/ are high.

But one has to remind oneself that the word ‘get’ is also not pronounced as /dʒɛːt/, but as /gɛːt/, e...
